sentences.en: Although she was groggy, she managed to flash me a grin.
sentences.cn: 尽管她处于半昏睡状态, 但仍尽力向我露出了微笑.

sentences.en: He's still groggy from the anaesthetic.
sentences.cn: 他用过麻药,现在仍眩晕无力.

sentences.en: I feel groggy now because I did not sleep well last night.
sentences.cn: 我现在有气无力,神智不清,昨晚没睡好.

sentences.en: I felt really groggy after 15 hours on the plane.
sentences.cn: 我乘了15个小时的飞机，感到昏昏沉沉的。

sentences.en: It takes away our edge, makes us groggy, and disrupts our sleep.
sentences.cn: 它让我们反应迟钝, 头昏脑胀,扰乱我们的睡眠.

sentences.en: She was feeling a bit groggy when I saw her.
sentences.cn: 我看见她的时候，她有点虚弱无力。
她手术后的的情况依然很不稳定.

sentences.en: That groggy state contrasts sharply with the rested feeling you have when you wake up naturally.
sentences.cn: 那种昏昏沉沉的状态和自然醒来的轻松感简直没法比.

sentences.en: The attack of flu left her feeling very groggy.
The injured man was still groggy and could only give a garbled account of the accident.
sentences.cn: 受伤的男子仍不很清醒,只能含糊地说出事故的情形.

sentences.en: The last attack of influenza has left me rather groggy.
sentences.cn: 上次患流行性感冒后使我至今软弱无力.

sentences.en: These can serve to make you groggy and less able to react properly.
sentences.cn: 低脂肪、均衡比例的[瘦肉蛋白质][效碳水化合物]是最好的食物;(尔夫)手应大量食用.

sentences.en: When I left my bed after my long illness, I felt too groggy to stand.
sentences.cn: 久病之后我下床走路, 只觉得身体软弱得站立不稳.

words.tran_cn: 用热水从空酒桶中浸出酒
酒醉的，无力的；东歪西倒的

trans.tran_cn: 不会的，不稳的，摇摆的，昏昏沉沉的
